Projects.name: Pod Guild
Projects.caption: Platform to connect podcast hosts and guests
Projects.altText: Screenshot preview of the desktop version of the Pod Guild app
Projects.description: The capstone project for my evening class at the PDX Code Guild, the idea for Pod Guild came from a friend, who had been hosting a podcast for our fantasy football league. The concept was simple: help hosts find qualified people to interview and help people who wish to share knowledge find an outlet. It also served as a great way to explore the MERN stack and was my first exposure to a JavaScript backend.

Projects.name: States Game
Projects.caption: A fun variation of 'Chandler's dumb states game' from Friends
Projects.altText: Screenshot preview of the desktop version of the States Game app
Projects.description: This one was a lot of fun. The idea stemmed from a recent viewing of the Friends episode, 'The One Where Chandler Doesn't Like Dogs', before taking on a life of its own. If you're a fan of the show, it's possible you'll catch many of the subtle references sprinkled throughout. It was also a great opportunity to practice a bit more with React Hooks and building forms with React.

Projects.name: Stocker
Projects.caption: Displays most recent tweets based on specific stock symbols
Projects.altText: Screenshot preview of the desktop version of the Stocker app
Projects.description: The only externally motivated project on the list, this app was built as part of a job application process. While it didn't technically serve its purpose, i.e. I didn't get the job, it taught me a lot about async/await, 3rd party APIs, the spread operator and how to properly map in JavaScript. Every experience is a learning opportunity.

Projects.name: Make-A-Meowm
Projects.caption: Cat-Themed Meme Generator
Projects.altText: Screenshot preview of the desktop version of the Make-A-Meowm app
Projects.description: Inspired by the 'Intro to React' course on Scrimba, and powered by my love for cats, this was my very 1st experience with React. It was a lesson on working with classes, state, object destructuring, fetching data and handling JSON. It was the launching point for my newfound obsession with the JavaScript library and many of the 'meowm' results still have me cracking up to this day.

Projects.name: Food Cart City
Projects.caption: Food Cart Database for Portland, OR
Projects.altText: Screenshot preview of the desktop version of the Food Cart City app
Projects.description: The O.G. as far as applications go for me. While far from a perfect piece and with still plenty of room to grow, this project was the original capstone for my full-time bootcamp course at the PDX Code Guild. It was a multi-month pursuit, forged with plenty of 'head on keyboard' moments. In the end, it was a privilege to present it to my class as both the culmination of what we had learned and the foundation of where it would now lead.

Projects.name: An Oasis in Space
Projects.caption: Personal travel website for a six-month trip around the world
Projects.altText: Screenshot preview of the desktop version of the An Oasis in Space website
Projects.description: This was truly the beginning. Self-taught via the likes of freeCodeCamp, Team Treehouse & Codecademy, I aimed to assemble a site that would allow for a chronicling of a once-in-a-lifetime, global adventure. While I am admittedly hesitant to share, as it is far from my best work, I do so to highlight how far I've grown as a developer and to be reminded of my love for travel, photography and the written word.
